OCD.name: EncryptedQuery Flink-JDBC Runner
OCD.description: Allows for the instantiation of Flink-JDBC Runners through OSGi configuration.

AD.name: Name
AD.description: Short name of this query runner. This name is used to identify the DataSource to the Querier componentso queries can be submitted using this name for execution.

AD.name: Description
AD.description: Description of this query runner for display to the end user.

AD.name: data.schema.name
AD.description: Name of the DataSchema describing the fields and partitioners.

AD.name: .column.encryption.class.name
AD.description: Class name of the encryption method to be used.

AD.name: .mod.pow.class.name
AD.description: Class name of the Modulus Power method to be used.

AD.name: .jni.library.path
AD.description: Comma separated list of native libraries to load. Optional.

AD.name: .computer.threshold
AD.description: Amount of data to process before consolidation. Larger numbers require more memory per task. Defaults to 30000

AD.name: .flink.parallelism
AD.description: Number of Flink concurrent tasks assigned to execute this query. Defaults to Flinks configured default.

AD.name: .column.encryption.partition.count
AD.description: How many partitions to create for column encryption. Defaults to 1.

AD.name: jdbc.driver
AD.description: Class name for the JDBC Driver to access the database.

AD.name: jdbc.url
AD.description: URL to connect to the database.

AD.name: jdbc.query
AD.description: SQL query that selects the data to be queried.

AD.name: Flink Installation Directory
AD.description: Directory where Flink runtime is installed.

AD.name: Additional Flink Argumments
AD.description: Additional arguments to be passed to Flink 'run' command when executing the query.

AD.name: .jar.file.path
AD.description: Path to the flink-jdbc jar file. This is the jar file implementing the query execution.

AD.name: Run Directory
AD.description: Path to a directory to use as the parent directory to store temporary files during the execution of the query.Every execution will create temporary directories under this one.

AD.name: Maximum number of hits per selector.
AD.description: Optional, default is 100. Must be positive integer > 0.
